ol.li: The binomial coefficient ~_nC_k~ is the coefficient of the term containing b^k in the expansion of (a+b)^n.
The numbers in Pascal's triangle are the binomial coefficients. Specifically, the number in the k^{\text{th}} position (starting with k=0) of the n^{\text{th}} row of the triangle is ~_nC_k~ .

li.p: If n is a positive integer, n! = n \cdot (n-1) \cdot (n-2) \cdot \cdots \cdot 3\cdot 2 \cdot 1
